CHAPTER XLII.

Our Peace is not to be in Human Keepz'ng. God.

Nov. 3. Y son, lf you put your peace with any one because you live with him and think as he does*

You will be wavering and entangled.

Betake yourself unto the truth that ever lives, that ever stays ;

Then partings and the death of friends shall never sadden you.

Love for your friend should have its root in Me,

And every one that here seems good to you and very dear,

Should, for My sake, be loved.

Apart from Me friendship is nothing, cannot last,

And there is no pure love, nor true,

Where Ijoin not the lovers.
